title: Statistical Physics Perspective on Economic Inequality. (arXiv:2307.02470v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: This article is a supplement to my main contribution to the Routledge Handbook of Complexity Economics (2023). On the basis of three recent papers, it presents an unconventional perspective on economic inequality from a statistical physics point of view. One section demonstrates empirical evidence for the exponential distribution of income in 67 countries around the world. The exponential distribution was not familiar to mainstream economists until it was introduced by physicists by analogy with the Boltzmann-Gibbs distribution of energy and subsequently confirmed in empirical data for many countries. Another section reviews the two-class structure of income distribution in the USA. translated_title: 经济不平等的统计物理视角
translated_abstract: 本文是我在《复杂经济学手册》（2023）中主要贡献的补充。基于最近的三篇论文，从统计物理的角度提出了一种非传统的经济不平等视角。其中一节展示了全球67个国家收入的指数分布的实证证据。指数分布在主流经济学家中并不常见，直到物理学家通过类比玻尔兹曼-吉布斯分布能量的方式引入，并通过实证数据在许多国家得到确认。另一节回顾了美国收入分配的两类结构。虽然指数定律描述了大多数人口（下层阶级），但收入分布的顶尾（上层阶级）以帕累托幂定律为特征，并且之间没有明确定义的中产阶级。因此，整个分布可以仅使用这两个定律非常好地拟合。
tldr: 这篇论文从统计物理的角度，通过实证数据证明了全球收入的指数分布以及美国收入分配的两类结构，这对于经济学中的经济不平等问题提供了新的视角和解释。
en_tdlr: This paper provides a new perspective and explanation for economic inequality by demonstrating the exponential distribution of global income and the two-class structure of income distribution in the USA from a statistical physics point of view.
